intro: Acinodendron laetum, commonly known as the golden star tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and emits a sweet fragrance, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
